page.title: 20TRANSPORT & COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The A19 which runs north-south on the low lying land in the west of the D-block, is a major road connecting the industrial areas of Teesside and Wearside to the main routes south (A1 & M1). It has always been a major routeway. In the days of the stagecoach the Tontine Inn was built at the junction of the Thirsk-Yarm and Thirsk-Sunderland roads. It now stands at the junction of the A19 and A172. The A172 skirts the higher land of the Cleveland Hills and connects the villages lying at the foot of these hills to the market town of Stokesley. A road climbs the hills along the route of the Old Drove Road through Scarth Nick down towards Osmotherley. There is an infrequent bus service in the area. The nearest rail connection is at Northallerton. Teesside Airport, near Darlington also serves this area.
